TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit GacInstalled extends System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase implements class System.Security.Policy.IIdentityPermissionFactory

Docs.summary: Confirms that a code assembly originates in the global assembly cache (GAC) as evidence for policy evaluation. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The presence of GacInstalled evidence produces a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> in the grant set. If there is a <xref:System.Security.CodeAccessPermission.Demand%2A> for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission>, the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> that corresponds to the GacInstalled evidence is compared with the demanded permission.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the GacInstalled class.
[!CODE [System.Security.Policy.Gac#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Policy.Gac#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled"> class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The constructor sets no property values because a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> object has no properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission CreateIdentityPermission(class System.Security.Policy.Evidence evidence) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Security.Policy.Evidence"> from which to construct the identity permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a new identity permission that corresponds to the current object.
Docs.returns: A new identity permission that corresponds to the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> can be used to determine whether the calling code is in the global assembly cache.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the CreateIdentityPermission method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> class.
[!CODE [System.Security.Policy.Gac#3](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Policy.Gac#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object o) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current object.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equivalent to the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> objects have no properties to distinguish one from another, so all <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> objects are equal.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the Equals method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a hash code for the current object.
Docs.returns: A hash code for the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetHashCode method returns 0 (zero) because <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> objects have no properties to distinguish one from another.
